title: HTML Basics — Start Building Web Pages
description: Learn the basic structure of an HTML document and the most common HTML tags.
learningObjectives: Understand the basic structure of an HTML document
Learn how to use common tags like `<html>`, `<head>`, and `<body>`
Create a simple web page with text content
realWorldApplications: Building simple static web pages
Creating a basic website structure
Learning foundational HTML for further web development

tasks.title: Create a Basic HTML Document
tasks.description: Create a basic HTML structure with the `<!DOCTYPE html>`, `<html>`, `<head>`, and `<body>` tags.
tasks.errorHint: Use the `<!DOCTYPE html>` declaration and wrap your content inside `<html>`, `<head>`, and `<body>` tags.

tasks.title: Add a Heading and Paragraph
tasks.description:
Inside the `` tag, add a `

` heading and a `

` paragraph.
tasks.solution:
Welcome to My Website

This is my first webpage.
tasks.errorHint:
Use the `

` tag for the heading and the `

` tag for the paragraph.

tasks.title: View Web Page in Browser
tasks.description: Save your HTML document and open it in a browser to see the result.
tasks.initialCode:
Welcome to My Website

This is my first webpage.
tasks.errorHint: Ensure the file is saved with the `.html` extension and opened in a browser.

title: HTML Lists — Display Data in a List Format
description: Learn how to create ordered and unordered lists using `<ol>` and `<ul>` tags.
prerequisites: HTML Basics — Start Building Web Pages
learningObjectives: Learn to create unordered lists (`<ul>`) and ordered lists (`<ol>`) in HTML
Use list items (`<li>`) to define each item in a list
Understand the difference between ordered and unordered lists
realWorldApplications: Displaying lists of items like menu items or shopping lists
Organizing content into bullet points or numbered steps
Improving content readability on websites

tasks.title: Create an Unordered List
tasks.description: Use the `<ul>` tag to create a list of your favorite fruits, and wrap each fruit in a `<li>` tag.
tasks.errorHint: Use the `<ul>` tag for unordered lists and wrap each item in a `<li>` tag.

tasks.title: Create an Ordered List
tasks.description: Use the `<ol>` tag to create a list of the first three steps in a process, such as making a cup of tea.
tasks.errorHint: Use the `<ol>` tag for ordered lists and wrap each item in a `<li>` tag.

tasks.title: Add Nested List Items
tasks.description: Create a list of categories and under each category, create a nested list of items.
tasks.errorHint: Use nested `<ul>` tags inside `<li>` tags to create a sublist.

title: HTML Links — Navigate Between Web Pages
description: Learn how to create hyperlinks using the `<a>` tag to navigate between pages or to external websites.
prerequisites: HTML Lists — Display Data in a List Format
learningObjectives: Learn to use the `<a>` tag for creating links
Understand how to link to other web pages, sections, or external websites
Use the `href` attribute to define the link destination
realWorldApplications: Creating navigation menus
Building links to related content on other websites
Improving user experience by providing easy navigation

tasks.title: Create a Link to Another Web Page
tasks.description: Create a link that takes the user to a new web page (e.g., 'about.html').
tasks.errorHint: Use the `href` attribute to specify the destination of the link.

tasks.title: Create a Link to an External Website
tasks.description: Create a link that takes the user to an external website (e.g., https://www.example.com).
tasks.errorHint: Provide the full URL (including http:// or https://) in the `href` attribute.

tasks.title: Link to a Specific Section on the Same Page
tasks.description: Create an anchor link that navigates to a specific section of the same page.
tasks.expectedOutput: Anchor link to section created successfully!
tasks.errorHint: Use `id` on the target element and `#id` in the link's `href`.

title: HTML Images — Adding Visual Content
description: Learn how to embed images into web pages using the `` tag.
prerequisites: HTML Links — Navigate Between Web Pages
learningObjectives: Understand how to use the `` tag to display images
Learn the role of the `src` and `alt` attributes
Make images responsive for mobile screens
realWorldApplications: Adding logos and icons to websites
Embedding pictures and illustrations
Building image galleries and media content

tasks.title: Add an Image to a Web Page
tasks.description: Use the `` tag to embed an image from your local directory.
tasks.errorHint: Use the `src` attribute to specify the image file path and `alt` for a description.

tasks.title: Display an Image from an External URL
tasks.description: Use an image hosted on an external website by specifying the full URL in the `src` attribute.
tasks.errorHint: Provide the full URL (including `http://` or `https://`) in the `src` attribute.

tasks.title: Make Image Responsive
tasks.description: Add an image to a web page and use CSS to make the image responsive on all screen sizes.
tasks.expectedOutput: Image responsive on different screen sizes!
tasks.errorHint: Use `width: 100%` and `height: auto` in the inline style or external CSS.

title: HTML Forms — Collect User Input
description: Learn how to create forms to collect user data, including text input, checkboxes, radio buttons, and submit buttons.
learningObjectives: Understand how to create and structure forms using `<form>`, `<input>`, `<textarea>`, `<select>`, and `<button>`
Learn how to use form elements like text fields, radio buttons, and checkboxes
Understand form submission and action attributes
realWorldApplications: Building contact forms
Creating surveys or quizzes
Collecting user registration and login details

tasks.title: Create a Basic Form
tasks.description: Create a basic form with a text input field and a submit button.
tasks.solution:
<form action='#'>
<input type='text' name='username' placeholder='Enter your name'>
<button type='submit'>Submit</button>
</form>
tasks.errorHint: Use the `<form>` tag for the form container and `<input>` for user inputs.

tasks.title: Add Checkbox and Radio Buttons
tasks.description: Add checkboxes for selecting interests and radio buttons for gender selection in the form.
tasks.solution:
Coding
Male
Female
tasks.expectedOutput: Checkboxes and radio buttons displayed correctly!
tasks.errorHint: Use `type='checkbox'` for checkboxes and `type='radio'` for radio buttons.

tasks.title: Create a Textarea
tasks.description: Add a `textarea` field where users can type longer comments.
tasks.errorHint: Use `<textarea>` to allow users to enter multiple lines of text.

title: HTML Tables — Organize Data in Rows and Columns
description: Learn how to create and structure tables to display data in rows and columns.
learningObjectives: Learn to create tables using the `<table>`, `<tr>`, `<td>`, and `<th>` tags
Understand how to structure rows and columns in a table
Style tables for better readability
realWorldApplications: Displaying product lists
Presenting tabular data like schedules or prices
Creating sortable or paginated tables in web applications

tasks.title: Create a Simple Table
tasks.description: Create a basic table with three rows and two columns using the `<table>`, `<tr>`, `<td>`, and `<th>` tags.
tasks.errorHint: Use `<table>`, `<tr>`, `<th>`, and `<td>` tags to structure the table.

tasks.title: Add Table Head and Body
tasks.description: Create a table with a `<thead>` for the header and `<tbody>` for the table body.
tasks.expectedOutput: Table with header and body created successfully!
tasks.errorHint: Use `<thead>` and `<tbody>` to separate the header from the body of the table.

tasks.title: Add Table Footer
tasks.description: Add a footer to the table using the `<tfoot>` tag to display summary data.
tasks.errorHint: Use `<tfoot>` to add a footer section to the table.

title: HTML Media — Embedding Audio and Video
description: Learn how to embed audio and video content in a webpage using `<audio>` and `<video>` tags.
prerequisites: HTML Tables — Organize Data in Rows and Columns
learningObjectives: Understand how to embed audio and video with the `<audio>` and `<video>` tags
Use attributes like `controls`, `autoplay`, and `loop` for media playback
Learn to link to external media files
realWorldApplications: Adding background music or audio clips to a website
Embedding tutorials, videos, or multimedia content
Creating interactive media elements in web applications

tasks.title: Embed an Audio File
tasks.description: Embed an audio file into the page using the `<audio>` tag with a 'play' button.
tasks.solution:
<audio controls>
<source src='audio.mp3' type='audio/mp3'>
Your browser does not support the audio element.
</audio>
tasks.errorHint: Use the `<audio>` tag and provide the file source with `<source>`.

tasks.title: Embed a Video File
tasks.description: Embed a video file into the page using the `<video>` tag with playback controls.
tasks.solution:
<video controls>
<source src='video.mp4' type='video/mp4'>
Your browser does not support the video element.
</video>
tasks.errorHint: Use the `<video>` tag and provide the file source with `<source>`.

tasks.title: Make Video Auto Play and Loop
tasks.description: Add attributes to the `<video>` tag to make the video autoplay and loop indefinitely.
tasks.solution:
<video autoplay loop>
<source src='video.mp4' type='video/mp4'>
Your browser does not support the video element.
</video>
tasks.expectedOutput: Video plays automatically and loops successfully!
tasks.errorHint: Use the `autoplay` and `loop` attributes in the `<video>` tag.

title: HTML Forms Validation — Validate User Input
description: Learn how to validate user input in forms using the `required`, `pattern`, and `min`/`max` attributes.
prerequisites: HTML Media — Embedding Audio and Video
learningObjectives: Understand form input validation
Learn to use the `required`, `pattern`, and `min`/`max` attributes for validation
Ensure proper input format for email, phone numbers, and text fields
realWorldApplications: Validating user input in contact forms
Ensuring proper email or phone number formatting
Building secure login and registration forms

tasks.title: Make a Text Field Required
tasks.description: Use the `required` attribute to make a text field mandatory in a form.
tasks.errorHint: Use the `required` attribute to make the input mandatory.

tasks.title: Validate Email Format
tasks.description: Use the `pattern` attribute to ensure the email input follows the proper email format.
tasks.errorHint: Use the `pattern` attribute to validate the email format.

tasks.title: Set Minimum Age for Registration
tasks.description: Use the `min` attribute to set a minimum age for a user to register.
tasks.expectedOutput: Age input validated successfully with a minimum value!
tasks.errorHint: Use the `min` attribute to set a minimum value for numerical inputs.

title: HTML Semantic Elements — Improve Accessibility
description: Learn how to use semantic elements to improve the accessibility and readability of your web pages.
prerequisites: HTML Forms Validation — Validate User Input
learningObjectives: Understand the importance of semantic HTML
Learn to use elements like `<header>`, `<footer>`, `<article>`, and `<section>`
Improve accessibility and SEO with proper semantic structure
realWorldApplications: Creating more readable and accessible web pages
Improving SEO for better search engine ranking
Making websites more inclusive for people with disabilities

tasks.title: Use `<header>` and `<footer>`
tasks.description: Wrap the header and footer content of your webpage with `<header>` and `<footer>` tags.
tasks.errorHint: Wrap the page's header and footer content in the appropriate `<header>` and `<footer>` tags.

tasks.title: Use `<article>` and `<section>`
tasks.description: Use the `<article>` and `<section>` elements to organize content into logical sections.
tasks.errorHint: Use `<article>` to define standalone content and `<section>` to group related content.

tasks.title: Make Navigation More Semantic
tasks.description: Use the `<nav>` tag to define the navigation section of your webpage.
tasks.errorHint: Use the `<nav>` element to wrap the website's primary navigation links.
